units.title: High‑resolution clustering and annotation
units.text: We clustered cells at high resolution in each dataset and assigned cell annotations based on known marker gene expression and differential expression between clusters (Supplementary Table 2).
units.rationale: Describes the initial clustering and labeling step.

units.title: Batch‑effect assessment and integration method selection
units.text: To address batch effects and achieve a robust integration, we assessed 12 different data‑integration methods using the proportion of cell types in each organoid sample and compared the similarity of each cell type with counterparts in adult and fetal tissues and selected scPoli to generate an integrated embedding of all organoid cells, enabling a cohesive representation of the diverse data.
units.rationale: Outlines how integration methods were evaluated and chosen.

units.title: Reannotation of integrated atlas
units.text: The integrated atlas was reannotated based on the most frequent cell type in each cluster, resulting in 5 cell classes at level 1, 48 cell types at level 2 and 51 cell subtypes at level 3.
units.rationale: Specifies the step of refining cell‑type labels after integration.

units.title: Quantification of cell‑type proportions for similarity analysis
units.text: We quantified the proportion of cell types in each organoid sample and compared the similarity of each cell type with counterparts in adult and fetal tissues.
units.rationale: Details the metric used to evaluate organoid similarity to reference tissues.

units.title: Pseudo‑bulk variance analysis
units.text: Pseudo‑bulk analysis using both raw and scPoli embedding on all organoid single‑cell datasets revealed stem cell source and tissue type as primary drivers of variance.
units.rationale: Describes a downstream analysis to identify major sources of variation.

units.title: Reintegration and hierarchical cell‑type definition
units.text: We reintegrated all cells and defined 5 cell types at level 1, 26 cell types at level 2 and 32 cell types at level 3 in the atlas.
units.rationale: Provides the final hierarchical classification after reintegration.

units.title: Subset and reintegration of specific lineages
units.text: We subsetted and reintegrated stem cells and enterocytes, and found that ...
units.rationale: Indicates a focused reanalysis of particular cell populations.

units.title: Data collection for downstream analysis
units.text: In total, we collected 806,646 cells to be utilized for downstream integration and analysis (Fig. 1a–d).
units.rationale: States the scale of data gathered for the workflow.

units.title: On‑target percentage assessment
units.text: Notably, we obtained data of each organoid with an average on‑target percentage of 91.12% in FSC‑derived organoids and 98.14% in ASC‑derived organoids.
units.rationale: Reports quality control metric used before integration.

units.title: Label‑aware hierarchical annotation framework
units.text: With label‑aware integration, we established a three‑level hierarchical cell‑type annotation: class (level 1), type (level 2) and subtype (level 3) (Fig. 2a,b).
units.rationale: Describes the structured annotation scheme applied to the data.
